title: Biden to talk up U.S. manufacturing at groundbreaking for Intel plant in Ohio
text:
Related: Biden signs into law $280 billion package for chips, scientific research â€” here's what's in it

Jean-Pierre said the plant in Ohio's Licking County will be built by union labor, creating more than 7,000 construction jobs and 3,000 jobs producing leading-edge chips.

"Thanks to the president's economic plan, U.S. manufacturing is back," she told reporters during a briefing.

Republicans have made Biden's handling of the economy their top issue, as they aim to take control of the U.S. House and Senate in November's midterm elections.

See: Under pressure due to inflation, Biden blasts Republicans for 'ultra-MAGA' plan that would 'raise taxes on working families'

Intel INTC in June had delayed the groundbreaking for the plant, signaling its frustration over the uncertainty in Congress at that time about the legislation providing more than $52 billion for the U.S. chips sector.

Intel's stock is down 40% this year, while the S&P 500 SPX has lost 16%.

Related: Chip stocks could plunge another 25% as 'we are entering the worst semiconductor downturn in a decade,' analyst says

Biden to talk up U.S. manufacturing at groundbreaking for Intel plant in Ohio
